document.title: Notes on the history of Liouville’s theorem

para.p:
We denote by
⁢ B
(
R n
)
the set of all linear maps
→
R n
R n
. We take it as known that with the operator norm

⁢ B
(
R n
)
is a Banach space.

If
∈ A
⁢ B
(
R n
)
, then

Math.text: determinant@(I + epsilon * A + o * epsilon) = 1 + epsilon * [tr] * A + o * epsilon

para.p:
as
→ ϵ 0
.

Let
λ 1
, … ,
λ n
be the eigenvalues of
A
, repeated according to algebraic multiplicity. For
> ϵ 0
, the eigenvalues of
+ I
⁢ ϵ A
⁢ o
( ϵ )
repeated according to algebraic multiplicity are

Math.text: list@(1 + epsilon * lambda _ 1 + o * epsilon, ldots, 1 + epsilon * lambda _ n + o * epsilon)

para.p:
as
→ ϵ 0
. The determinant of a linear map
→
R n
R n
is the product of its eigenvalues according to algebraic multiplicity, so

Math.text: determinant@(I + epsilon * A + o * epsilon) = ((product _ (k = 1)) ^ n)@(1 + epsilon * lambda _ k + o * epsilon)

para.p:
as
→ ϵ 0
. But

Math.text: ((product _ (k = 1)) ^ n)@(1 + epsilon * lambda _ k + o * epsilon) = 1 + epsilon * ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ n)@(lambda _ k) + o * epsilon = 1 + epsilon * [tr] * A + o * epsilon

para.p:
as
→ ϵ 0
. ∎

If
∈ A
⁢ B
(
R n
)
, then

Math.text: determinant@(e ^ A) = e ^ ([tr] * A)

para.p: We have

Math.text: e ^ A = (limit _ (m to infinity))@((I + A / m) ^ m)

para.p:
As
: det
→
⁢ B
(
R n
)
R
is continuous, we have

Math.text: determinant@(e ^ A) = (limit _ (m to infinity))@(determinant@((I + A / m) ^ m))

para.p: Then, using Lemma ,

Math.text: determinant@(e ^ A) = (limit _ (m to infinity))@((determinant@(I + A / m)) ^ m) = (limit _ (m to infinity))@((1 + (1 / m) * [tr] * A + o * (1 / m)) ^ m) = e ^ ([tr] * A)
determinant@(e ^ A)
(limit _ (m to infinity))@((determinant@(I + A / m)) ^ m)
(limit _ (m to infinity))@((1 + (1 / m) * [tr] * A + o * (1 / m)) ^ m)
e ^ ([tr] * A)

para.p:
If
∈ A
⁢ B
(
R n
)

A
is

Math.text: open-interval@(t, x) maps-to e ^ (t * A) * x

para.p:
For each
t
we have
∈
e
⁢ t A
⁢ B
(
R n
)
, and by Theorem we have

Math.text: determinant@(e ^ (t * A)) = e ^ ([tr] * t * A) = e ^ (t * [tr] * A)

para.p:
Let
λ
be Lebesgue measure on
R n
. If
U
is an open subset of
R n
, then

Math.text: lambda * e ^ (t * A) * U = (integral _ (e ^ (t * A) * U))@(differential-d@(y)) = (integral _ U)@(absolute-value@(determinant@(D * e ^ (t * A) * x)) * differential-d@(x)) = (integral _ U)@(absolute-value@(determinant@(e ^ (t * A))) * differential-d@(x)) = e ^ (t * [tr] * A) * lambda * U

para.p:
Therefore,
λ
is an invariant measure for the flow if and only if
=
⁢ tr A
0
, namely, if and only if
A
is skew-symmetric.

Suppose that
I
is an open interval and
∈ A

)
)

X
of all functions
: x
→ I
R n
that satisfy the differential equation

Math.text: dot@(x) * t = A * t * x * t

para.p:
is a vector space. For each

⁢
B 0

x 0

Math.text: formulae@(dot@(Phi) * t * e _ i = (d / (d * t)) * Phi * t * e _ i = dot@(phi _ i) * t = A * t * phi _ i * t, t element-of I)

para.p: and hence

Math.text: formulae@(dot@(Phi) * t = A * t * Phi * t, t element-of I)

para.p:
The Wronskian
= W
⁢ W
(
ϕ 1
,
⁢ …
ϕ n
)
of the ordered set
ϕ 1
, … ,
ϕ n
is the function that assigns to each
∈ t I
the oriented volume of the parallelepiped spanned by
⁢
ϕ 1
( t )
, … ,
⁢
ϕ n
( t )
. That is,

Math.text: formulae@(W * t = determinant@(Phi * t), t element-of I)

para.p:
Suppose that
I
is an open interval and that
∈ A
⁢ C
( I ,
⁢ B
(
R n
)
)

∈
ϕ 1
, … ,

X
, then the Wronskian
= W
⁢ W
(
ϕ 1

Math.text: formulae@(dot@(W) * t = [tr] * A * t * W * t, t element-of I)

para.p:
By (), for each
∈ t I
we have

Math.text: Phi * (t + Delta) = Phi * t + dot@(Phi) * t * Delta + o * Delta = Phi * t + A * t * Phi * t * Delta + o * Delta = Phi * t + A * t * Phi * t * Delta + o * Phi * t * Delta = Phi * t * (I + A * t * Delta + o * Delta) = Phi * t * (I + A * t * Delta + o * Delta)
Phi * (t + Delta)
Phi * t + dot@(Phi) * t * Delta + o * Delta
Phi * t + A * t * Phi * t * Delta + o * Delta
Phi * t + A * t * Phi * t * Delta + o * Phi * t * Delta
Phi * t * (I + A * t * Delta + o * Delta)
Phi * t * (I + A * t * Delta + o * Delta)

para.p:
as
→ Δ 0
. Using Lemma we get

Math.text: W * (t + Delta) = determinant@(Phi * (t + Delta)) = determinant@(Phi * t * determinant@(I + A * t * Delta + o * Delta)) = determinant@(Phi * t * (1 + [tr] * A * t * Delta + o * Delta)) = determinant@(Phi * t) + determinant@(Phi * t * [tr] * A * t * Delta) + o * determinant@(Phi * t * Delta) = determinant@(Phi * t) + determinant@(Phi * t * [tr] * A * t * Delta) + o * Delta
W * (t + Delta)
determinant@(Phi * (t + Delta))
determinant@(Phi * t * determinant@(I + A * t * Delta + o * Delta))
determinant@(Phi * t * (1 + [tr] * A * t * Delta + o * Delta))
determinant@(Phi * t) + determinant@(Phi * t * [tr] * A * t * Delta) + o * determinant@(Phi * t * Delta)
determinant@(Phi * t) + determinant@(Phi * t * [tr] * A * t * Delta) + o * Delta

para.p:
as
→ Δ 0
, i.e.,

Math.text: W * (t + Delta) = W * t + W * t * [tr] * A * t * Delta + o * Delta

para.p: which gives us

Math.text: dot@(W) * t = [tr] * A * t * W * t

para.p:
One checks that for any
∈
t 0
I
,

Math.text: formulae@(t maps-to W * t _ 0 * exponential@(((integral _ t _ 0) ^ t)@([tr] * A * tau * differential-d@(tau))), t element-of I)

para.p:
is a solution of the differential equation in Theorem . For each
∈ t I
we have that
↦ v

(

( t )

v
is linear, and in particular is locally Lipschitz, so by the existence and uniqueness theorem it follows that

Math.text: formulae@(W * t = W * t _ 0 * exponential@(((integral _ t _ 0) ^ t)@([tr] * A * tau * differential-d@(tau))), t element-of I)

para.p:
Let
Ω

Math.text: formulae@(Omega * vector@(x _ 1, ldots, x _ n) * determinant@(A) = list@(Omega * vector@(A * x _ 1, ldots, A * x _ n), x _ 1, ldots), x _ n element-of R ^ n)

para.p:
If
ω

R n

para.p:
Thus, if
∈

R n

ω
by

Math.text: omega * vector@(x _ 1, ldots, x _ (n - 1)) = Omega * vector@(x _ 0, A * x _ 1, ldots, A * x _ n)

para.p:
then there is some
x ω
with which

Math.text: Omega * vector@(x _ 0, A * x _ 1, ldots, A * x _ n) = Omega * vector@(x _ omega, x _ 1, ldots, x _ (n - 1))

Math.text: Omega * vector@(x _ 1, A * x _ 2, ldots, A * x _ n) = Omega * vector@(adj * A * x _ 1, x _ 2, ldots, x _ n)

para.p: Hence

Math.text: Omega * vector@(A * x _ 1, A * x _ 2, ldots, A * x _ n) = Omega * vector@(adj * A * A * x _ 1, x _ 2, ldots, x _ n)

para.p: therefore

Math.text: Omega * vector@(adj * A * A * x _ 1, x _ 2, ldots, x _ n) = Omega * vector@(x _ 1, ldots, x _ n) * determinant@(A)

para.p:
and because this holds for all

Math.text: adj * A * A = determinant@(A) * I

para.p:

If

Math.text: (d / (d * t)) * Omega * vector@(e _ 1, ldots, e _ n) * determinant@(A * t) = (d / (d * t)) * Omega * vector@(A * t * e _ 1, ldots, A * t * e _ n) = ((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@(Omega * vector@(A * t * e _ 1, ldots, dot@(A) * t * e _ i, ldots, A * t * e _ n)) = ((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@(Omega * vector@(e _ 1, ldots, adj * A * t * dot@(A) * t * e _ i, ldots, e _ n)) = Omega * vector@(e _ 1, ldots, e _ n) * [tr] * adj * A * t * dot@(A) * t
(d / (d * t)) * Omega * vector@(e _ 1, ldots, e _ n) * determinant@(A * t)

((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@(Omega * vector@(A * t * e _ 1, ldots, dot@(A) * t * e _ i, ldots, A * t * e _ n))
((sum _ (i = 1)) ^ n)@(Omega * vector@(e _ 1, ldots, adj * A * t * dot@(A) * t * e _ i, ldots, e _ n))
Omega * vector@(e _ 1, ldots, e _ n) * [tr] * adj * A * t * dot@(A) * t

para.p: that is,

Math.text: (d / (d * t)) * determinant@(A * t) = [tr] * adj * A * t * dot@(A) * t

para.p: Kline p. 798, Jacobi [], [, §17], Felix Klein, 19th century, chapter V

para.p:
this presumes that

det

Math.text: (d / (d * t)) * (integral _ U _ t)@(f * open-interval@(y, t) * differential-d@(y)) = (d / (d * t)) * (integral _ U)@(f * open-interval@(phi _ t * x, t) * determinant@(D * phi _ t * x * d * x)) = (integral _ U)@(D * f * open-interval@(phi _ t * x, t) * (dot@(phi)) _ t * x * determinant@(D * phi _ t * x)) + (partial-differential@(f) / partial-differential@(t)) * open-interval@(phi _ t * x, t) * determinant@(D * phi _ t * x) + f * open-interval@(phi _ t * x, t) * (d / (d * t)) * determinant@(D * phi _ t * x * d * x) = (integral _ U)@(((D * f) / (D * t)) * open-interval@(phi _ t * x, t) * determinant@(D * phi _ t * x)) + f * open-interval@(phi _ t * x, t) * (d / (d * t)) * determinant@(D * phi _ t * x * d * x)

(integral _ U)@(D * f * open-interval@(phi _ t * x, t) * (dot@(phi)) _ t * x * determinant@(D * phi _ t * x))

+ (partial-differential@(f) / partial-differential@(t)) * open-interval@(phi _ t * x, t) * determinant@(D * phi _ t * x) + f * open-interval@(phi _ t * x, t) * (d / (d * t)) * determinant@(D * phi _ t * x * d * x)
